intro: Delissea angustifolia f. subpubescens, commonly known as the narrow-leaf delissea, is a flowering plant characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is native to specific regions in southern Africa. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its foliage is often covered with a fine layer of short, soft hairs, giving it a slightly fuzzy appearance.
